results.InstructionLong: Handling of Special Characters in Translation - % If a text contains % characters, for example: %d, %3.3d, %s and %ld, these positions cannot be modified or deleted and the sequence cannot be changed. - Format character: '\n' new line and '\t' tab Do not modify format characters during translation. Format characters must remain unchanged in the translated text. - End-of-text character " The end-of-text character " should not be inserted into the translation because texts are then truncated after this character. Use ' instead. - Fastpath character: '&' and '~' The character following the '&' character is a fastpath character. If possible, the fastpath character should be specified uniquely. The unambiguity of the fastpath cannot be ensured without a test. If you cannot test the translation, you can ignore the fastpath character. Please follow these rules. Special characters must be correct in the translations. Description of objects and where they are used can be found here: http://service.sap.com/~form/handler?_APP=01100107900000000342 &_EVENT=DISPL_TXT&_NNUM=150244&

results.InstructionShort: Translation from ES,FR,IT,NL, AND PT into EN (SAP_HR & EA_HR Only)
results.InstructionLong: How to find the graphs relevant for translation SLS language -> EN. As always, certain collections have an SLS language as original language and must be translated from this language into EN. SLS is responsible for these translations. Here is how to find the graphs relevant for translation SLS language -> EN. In the collection selection screen: - In "Selection Basis" click "Choose" on the "Graphs" line - On the next screen, choose "Next Variant" to the right twice (black arrows at the bottom) - You now have the graphs listed first by target language and then by original language. Go to enUS. Under the enUS node, you will see all source languages maintained for translation into EN. Double-click on the original language to select all relevant collections - If you find objects with original language other than DE, EN, ES, FR, IT, NL or PT in your worklist do not translate them but contact your PM. Note that the DE/EN deadline applies for all translation into EN!

TX COPYRIGHT* for all languages except DE, EN, ES, FR, IT, JA, PT, ZH (SAP_BASIS only) 1. These objects need to called up directly as the object type is not relevant for most of the languages. 2. Go to SE63 3. Enter TX 4. Enter COPYRIGHT*, press F4 5. Translate all listed objects

Duet Guidelines for CS, DA, DE, ES, FI, FR, HU, IT, ptBR, NL, PL, RU, 
SV, JA, KO, zhCN, zhTW: (All systems on SAP_BASIS 700 or higher; check 
also if there are Duet collection in your application)

The Duet packages are in the following graphs

- NW: Duet: All languages
- NW: SAP_BW: Duet: All languages except AR,SH,TH

Important: Duet has its own terminology in STERM under component OPU-
DUE. For the translation of these collections the automatic distribution 
has been deactivated. Please follow the process below:

Verify whether the string contains terminology that is specific to Duet.

If it does not contain Duet-specific terminology please translate as 
usual with the standard terminology.

If it contains Duet-specific terminology
a) translate the string with SAP standard terminology once in order to 
send a standard translation to the proposal pool
b) change the terminology and define the string as an exception

Duet specific information can be found under 
http://service.sap.com/~form/sapnet?_SHORTKEY=01100035870000626897
&_OBJECT=011000358700004503232006E

Single Objects Requiring Special Treatment although the objects appear 
in standard SE63 worklists (relevant for all languages if not otherwise 
specified): (SAP_BASIS Only)
- Table T015Z: see Note 1003839 - Translation of table T015Z
- Logical objects BSVI (Table TJ02T): Note 526363 - Translation of table 
TJ02T (logical objects BSVI)
- Table T006A - Units of Measure: Note 372410 - Translation of table 
T006A in SE63
- Table TRMSG (only relevant for DE,EN,CS,ES,FR,HU,IT,JA,NL,PL,PT,RU,SK 
who have it in their standard WLs)
- There are about 15 lines which are not translatable: when saving the 
object the previous translation appears in the translation line - or in 
some cases the line becomes untranslated again. Please ignore lines with 
this kind of - similar - behaviour. In case there are more 
untranslatable lines than expected, stop translation and report problem 
to PM.

PDFs for GTS are translated into much more languages than for other 
products. So please always check the statistics, even if you normally do 
not translate PDFs.
For details on how to translate PDFs in general, please see the 
following document:
http://service.sap.com/~form/sapnet?_SHORTKEY=01100035870000692482
&_OBJECT=011000358700001989582008E

For GTS PDF translation, there are special rules concerning translation-
relevance, templates and source languages. Please refer to the following 
list:
http://service.sap.com/~form/sapnet?_SHORTKEY=01100035870000735385
&_OBJECT=011000358700001322862010E

- Translation-relevance:
  If PDFs are marked in black in this list, they have to be translated 
into the respective target language if they appear in your worklist. 
  If the template is NOT on this list, the PDF must NOT be translated, 
even if it appears in your worklist!
- Templates:
  All PDFs marked in red in this list have to be translated according to 
the template! So please consider that you have to use the template for 
this translation, there is no "free" translation allowed!
- Source language:
  Some languages have to check the PDFs from a different source language 
than usual. Please pay attention whether your source language is DE or 
EN.


Not Translation-Relevant for GTS:

Irrelevant Tables:
The following tables are only relevant for translation into EN!
From GTS 7.1 SP05 on, they may appear again in the worklist, but please 
do not translate them into any other language except EN!

/SAPSLL/CUCAART Abgabenarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCAFAT Beantragte Begünstigung - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCAGGT Abgabengruppe Steuerbescheid - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCAPRT Zusatzverfahren - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCBMST Bemessungsmaßstab Steuerbescheid - Bez.
/SAPSLL/CUCCPGT Containerstatus
/SAPSLL/CUCDADT Definition Abgabenarten - Texttabelle
/SAPSLL/CUCDCT Art der Anmeldung für Global Trade Srv. - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCFDPT Packstückarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCINDT Kennzeichen Zollabwicklung
/SAPSLL/CUCMEST Meldungscodes - Bezeichnungen
/SAPSLL/CUCMOTT Art des Beförderungsmittels - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCMTRT Verkehrszweig
/SAPSLL/CUCNGAT Warenkreis - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPATT Vorpapierarten Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPOPT Ausstellende Behörde Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPQUT Qualifikator der Unterlage - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPROT Zollrechtliche Bestimmung Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPSTT Status einer Unterlage Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPTYT Packstückarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCPYTT Zahlungsarten - Bezeichnungen
/SAPSLL/CUCREST Kontrollergebnis Zoll - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCSLTT Verschlußarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCSTAT Zollrechtlicher Status der Ware - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCSTT Zollrechtlicher Status - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCSUST Aufschubarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCVAT Anmeldeart - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/CUCZAFT Zahlungsaufforderung für Steuerbescheid - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/LEGBTT Zollgeschäftsarten - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/LEGEPT Ausfuhrarten Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/LEGSLTT Sitz des Einführers - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/LEGSSTT Statistikstatus - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/TLEACMT Nachrichten zur Aktivität
/SAPSLL/TLEPAFT Aktivitätenfolge für Global Trade Srv. - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/TLEPRAT Prozessaktivitäten für Global Trade Services
/SAPSLL/TLEPRT Prozesse für Global Trade Services - Bezeichnung
/SAPSLL/TLEPST Prozessschema für Global Trade Services - Bezeichnung


Irrelevant TLGS:
/SAPSLL/PF_US_7525V
/SAPSLL/PF_US_CF3461
/SAPSLL/PF_US_CF7501
/SAPSLL/PF_US_CF7533
/SAPSLL/PF_US_COM_IN
/SAPSLL/PF_US_COO
/SAPSLL/PF_US_SLI
/SAPSLL/PF_CA_CCCF
/SAPSLL/PF_NAFTA_VD_1
/SAPSLL/PF_DE_CTAX 
/SAPSLL/PF_DE_CUSTST
/SAPSLL/PF_NAFTA_CA_COO; ATTENTION: Relevant for FR,ES
/SAPSLL/PF_NAFTA_COO; ATTENTION: Relevant for FR,ES
/SAPSLL/PF_NAFTA_MX_COO; ATTENTION: Relevant for FR,ES

Special objects:
1. Please manually check translation/translate the following single 
objects in all translation systems
Object type: TABT
Object names:
On all systems/basis levels:
/FLDQ/AD_CFG_RVW
/FLDQ/ADR_RVW_BT
/FLDQ/AD_VAL_CNT
/FLDQ/AD_SUPPROC
/FLDQ/AD_SUPPCCK
/FLDQ/AD_SCR_RVW
/FLDQ/AD_SCR_DUP
/FLDQ/AD_QTR_OBJ
/FLDQ/AD_CFGPRMS
/FLDQ/AD_RVW_CUS
/FLDQ/AD_SUGLBL
/FLDQ/AD_SUGFLD
(MDG related, may not be on all systems/basis-levels):
/FLDQ/AD_FUNCS
(CRM related, may not be on all systems/basis-levels):
/FLDQ/AD_MKTGDUP

Object type: VIEW
Object names: 
FLDQ/V_AD_RGNS

2. NOT to be translated: strings with technical names, single characters 
and numeric strings in the BC set /fldq/47u6x (se63 object type SCP1, 
object name /fldq/47u6x). 
Here some details about what should be translated and what not from 
development:

Also, as we have had issues in the past with one of our tables that is 
marked as translation-relevant, but not all values should be translated. 
Below is a reminder/list of the type of values that should NOT be 
translated (i.e., they should be left in their English original value).

In our bc set /fldq/47u6x (i.e., I see it via se63->scp1 for 
/fldq/47u6x), there were about 17 new records added (and possibly 
additional ones that were modified). 
Each of these records have error message text (which should be 
translated) and then other fields (values such as /FLDQ/AD_TECH_ERRORS, 
single character such as 'E', and numerics) - these should be left in 
their English/original values.

Example values in the /fldq/47u6x bc set:

"An error occurred during..." - text messages such as these should be 
translated in all languages

"/FLDQ/AD_TECH_ERRORS" - should be left as "/FLDQ/AD_TECH_ERRORS" in all 
languages

Single characters such as 'E' - should be left as 'E' in all languages 
(I believe these are the values that were translated in earlier versions 
and caused issues in our implementation)

Numeric - should be same value in all languages

3. TABL/TAIS CVERS_REF (All products)

This table must be called up and translated once after final WL-run.

Before starting any translation, make sure to set up the Virtual 
Translation Portal and TM server environment according to the latest 
instructions on the Virtual Translation Portal Splash screen. 

Please refer to the procedures for System Long Texts in the SAP Service 
Marketplace (http://service.sap.com/translation) under Tools -> System 
Translation -> ORBITT Infrastructure and for the SAP NetWeaver 
translation tools (LXE_MASTER, SLLS and SE63) under Tools -> System 
Translation -> SAP NetWeaver 7.40.

Info Object Title Translation

Please respect the length restriction in Knowledge Warehouse info object 
titles: max. 64 characters. This is to avoid that structure entries are 
cut off.

Special characters require special attention for all languages. Please 
replace the following special characters:

Em / En dash must be replaced with minus character (-)
Smart quotes must be replaced with vertical stroke (' or ") 
€ must be replaced with EUR or Euro (see S&Gs)

Translation Review/Web Browser Display


Please always use the Preview function in ORBITT ("Display Target") 
after having saved the translated info object in TagEditor as described 
in the document KW Translation - New Features, November 2013, which you 
can access in SAP Service Marketplace under Tools -> System Translation 
-> KW Translation.

Translating KW XDP PowerPoint slides (graphics) via ORBITT

Before translating PowerPoint slides via ORBITT for the first time, you 
must make certain security settings in PowerPoint on the Virtual 
Translation Portal. These settings are described in detail in the 
document PPT Security Settings for ORBITT Translation (KW), which can be 
found in SAP Service Marketplace under Tools -> System Translation -> 
ORBITT Infrastructure. 

Please follow the instructions for PPT translation and formatting, and 
the improved ORBITT functionality "Display Target" in the document KW 
Translation - New Features, November 2013, which you can access in SAP 
Service Marketplace under Tools -> System Translation -> KW Translation.

ORBITT for IxiaSoft Translation Tips & Tricks: http://service.sap.com/ ~sapidb/011000358700000068112014E Please refer to the procedures listed in the ORBITT documentation available on the Translation Portal splash screen. Trados Tags: Please do NOT unlock tag protection if you find any errors in XML tagging during translation (except if you are explicitly requested and instructed how to do so by your SAP project manager or quality engineer). Instead, you should report any XML errors to us via CSN (Component SLS-SRV-PM), indicating the collection and error description. Virtual Translation Portal: External translations can log on the Translation Portal using the external access http://mywtspartners.sap.com -> Translation Portal Issues: Please use the CSS component SLS-SRV-PM to report any technical issues.

Syclo non-ABAP Projects: 
1) Concatenated CamelCase strings such as SuccessfulLoginAction are 
variables that are used in internal logs and other technical texts. They 
will not be displayed to the end-users on the device and do not have to 
be translated.

2) Strings containing placeholders such as Rule 042%1042 or The %1 value 
is outside of the allowable range of %2 to %3 are used in error messages 
and console logs. The placeholders are parameters that will be replaced 
by an actual value on the device. As a rule of thumb the strings should 
be translated with the exception of the placeholders.

Business One String Information Portal (SIP): Please use SIP during 
translation. You can access SIP through VTP: 
http://sip.bts.global.corp.sap.

The String Information Portal (SIP) is designed to display additional 
references and context for user interface (UI) texts for SAP Business 
One® that are translated in translation system BOL. It aims to help 
language providers better understand the meaning of those strings and 
deliver better language quality for SAP Business One® products. 

The String Information Portal covers only strings from the SAP Business 
One® core. It does not cover strings from separately developed add-ons, 
analytics, or mobile apps. 

Variables: 
Variables must be copied exactly from the English source in the exact 
order of their original appearance!
The translation must contain exactly the same number of variables as the 
source text!
If a % variable is followed by a character (e.g. %s, %ld) this character 
must remain the same as in the source language!

Journal Display Strings (object SBO(S161)_92DEV,objecttype XTIT):
The abbreviations in the target languages MUST NOT EXCEED TWO 
CHARACTERS.
Do not use the same target language abbreviation for two different 
English source abbreviations; the chosen abbreviations must be UNIQUE in 
the target language within the object.

Table Categories (strings beginning with numbers, for example, 1 -24 
Affected Assets (object SBO(S33)_92DEV, object typeXTXT)):
The numbers at thebeginning of these strings are internalSAP Business 
One client identifiers oftable categories/sub-categories. Ifthese 
numbers are changed, this causesserious issues in the SAP Business 
Oneclient regarding the definition ofuser-defined fields.

Please ensure thatthe formatting of the numbers includingthe space 
between the numbers is copiedfrom the source text.

TABL/TAIS CVERS_REF and CVERS_TXT (All products)
This table must be called up and translated once after final WL-run.

F1 Help (object group C6) for CS: Translation relevant collections are 
in the graphs [NW: Records Management* for Netweaver]. F1 Help in all 
other NW Collections should be ignored.

F1 Help (object group C6) for CS: csCS does not translate F1 Help in the 
following graphs (ERP):

FI-CA*
FS-CD*
FS-CM*
INSURANCE*
IS-PS-CA: PS-HER*
IS-H*
OIL*
PS-HER*
RE-FX*
Utilities*
Healthcare*
HealthMed*
S/4HANA EHSM*
S/4HANA: SLC Retrofit*

Translation of PDF-based Forms (potentially all products based on Basis 
700 and above): Instructions on the PDF form translation - including 
previewing in transaction SFP, page 18: ORBITT for PDF - Step-by-Step 
(http://service.sap.com/~form/sapnet?_SHORTKEY=01100035870000692482
&_SCENARIO=01100035870000000112&_OBJECT=011000358700001989582008E)

Translation of OTR Texts (all products on Basis 640 or below): More 
information under 
http://help.sap.com/saphelp_snc70/helpdata/en/f8/dd8a0f276111d5b31600010
2a3fd99/content.htm?
frameset=/en/f8/dd8a0f276111d5b316000102a3fd99/frameset.htm

Release lower than 7.02 (SP5): (all)

Object type where only new objects are relevant:
SSF, WFLW and TEXT
Due to technical reasons for these object types only the new objects 
should be translated. If possible, this should only be done after the 
final worklists are available.
Previously translated objects are displayed as modified - and there is 
no way of telling whether a "modified" object is really modified or 
whether it is correctly translated.
Release 7.02 (SP5) or higher
Modified lines from object types SSF should be translated!

As of Release 703 as well as in NW730 and higher 
In translation systems on these releases, translators must now translate 
both new and modified objects for object types WFLW and TEXT.

Objects in LOWTABU graphs: ATTENTION - the rules changed here! . If you 
are translating objects belonging to lowtabu graphs, please translate 
any object type you find in your worklist, not only lowtabu object types 
like before.

results.InstructionShort: Special Texts and Tables for SAP APPL & SAP HR Only
results.InstructionLong:
Translation of Special Texts XSS Area Pages (SAP APPL & SAP HR only)
Relevant for all languages, all languages translate from their standard 
source language
Go to SE63 -> Translation -> ABAP Objects -> Special Texts XSS Area 
Pages
Double-click on T7XSSSERSTRLAN
Select your source language
Select your target language
Select all entries
Translate all entries
Tables CABNT/CAWNT (SAP APPL & SAP HR only)
These tables only appear in worklists for DE/EN, but they are relevant 
for all. Other languages must call them up directly in SE63. This must 
be done at least once after DE/EN completion.

results.InstructionShort: Learning Solution: Only in the Software Component LSOFE
results.InstructionLong:
Please check all TX objects starting with LSO*
SE63 -> TX -> LSO* ->press F4 -> choose with double click one by one, 
check and translate if necessary.
This rule is not valid for projects for LSO parts within software 
component EA-HR.

results.InstructionShort: Cloud for Customer: First priority translation
results.InstructionLong:
Translate the following two objects with highest priority, i.e. before 
you start the regular translation:
Object type: BCBS
Object name: BCBS/APBP/REL_CAT and BCBSBUPA_REL_CAT_INDU_BANK

Prepare this document for translation:
1. Make all texts editable.
2. Delete all unnecessary boxes outside of the printing area.
3. Convert all pages to A4.
4. Create an InDesign package with an idml file.

The file contains Google Ads that have length restrictions. Please don't exceed them. Find the length restrictions in Google's help page: https://support.google.com/adwordspolicy/answer/175910?hl=en To find the character counts for each section, unhide the column to the right.+

Where possible, we localize hashtags to help you run a local Twitter 
campaign and monitor it. 
However, should you prefer to keep the hashtags in English, please 
contact us.

Tweets have a length restriction of 140 characters. 
Do not exceed this.
To find the character count, go to the Code tab on the lower right of 
your translation editor in Smartling.

The upload deck file has length restrictions. 
Do not exceed them.
To find the character count, go to the Code tab on the lower right of 
your translation editor in Smartling.

Subtitles have a length restriction of 84 characters.
If you need to exceed the length of the English text, keep it to a 
reasonable minimum.

For both Chinese and western characters, use:
Font: MS Yahei 
Spacing: 2
Size: 60 pixels

results.InstructionShort: Subtitling // Long sentences for zhCN and jaJP
results.InstructionLong:
In Smartling, subtitles are displayed in one line. If a line is longer 
than 20 characters, insert a line break to continue on the next line.

Please include in your delivery a separate Word document containing a 
brief evaluation of the translation quality.

Ensure that translation is consistent with the texts within the 
screenshots. Find the screenshots in Smartling under the heading 
Document Instructions.

In on-screen texts, line-breaks are indicated by double slashes. Ensure 
that double slashes are in the right place in your translation.

If you need to exceed the length of the English on-screen text, keep it 
to a reasonable minimum.

Because they relate closely to the action on screen, be sure to maintain 
the position and order of words in bold.
test long

Format charactersmust remain unchanged in the translated text.- End-of-text character "The end-of-text character " should not be inserted into thetranslation because texts are then truncated after this character. Use' instead.- Fastpath character: '&' and '~'The character following the '&' character is a fastpath character. Ifpossible, the fastpath character should be specified uniquely. Theunambiguity of the fastpath cannot be ensured without a test. If youcannot test the translation, you can ignore the fastpath character.Please follow these rules. Special characters must be correct in thetranslations.Description of objects and where they are used can be found here:http://service.sap.com/~form/handler?_APP=01100107900000000342&_EVENT=DISPL_TXT&_NNUM=150244&
